stories.text:
Artist defacto forced to use IG for the last half-decade or face non-existence oblivion amongst professional peer community.

I've found it toxic and dysfunctional since day one but yet another corner seems to have been turned in it's decay.

I want to be on a more socially responsible minimal app, just tell me where to go.
stories.title: Ask HN: Alternatives to Instagram?
Michigan Became the Epicenter of the Modernist Experiment
Spotify users and artists react to CEO's €100M investment in defence tech
We can't stop workplace sexual harassment without banning NDAs
Google voluntarily de-lists The Pirate Bay

stories.text:
I am a startup founder, and we use a variety of applications for different areas. I spend quite some time tracking data every day, not adding time with the 2MFAs and separate password entries. Most of these applications stay logged in, but since I use the same machine for testing code pushes, I have to clear the cache from time to time.

Most of the time, I am looking for specific metrics across these applications, and if it's significant, I do deep-dives.

How do you keep track and be efficient across multiple applications?

PS: Some browser applications I review: Linkedin, Trello, Mailchimp, Intercom, Hubspot, Google Analytics, Freedcamp, Bitbucket, Gmail.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you manage time spent across the browser applications?
